episode.title: Burlington Northern Railroad Company v. Oklahoma Tax Commission

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Chief Justice Rehnquist
turn.text: The opinion of the Court in No. 86-337, Burlington Northern Railroad Company vs. Oklahoma Tax Commission will be announced by Justice Marshall.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: In this case which comes to us on certiorari from the United States Court of Appeals for the Tenth Circuit, the Court of Appeals held that the Railroad Revitalization and Regulatory Reform Act of 1976 does not permit railroads to challenge in Federal Courts allegedly discriminatory state taxation based upon overevaluation of railroad property.
For the reasons stated in an opinion today, we reverse the Court of Appeals.
